corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

sentence.text: And Ben had been a shadowy figure representing that other world ; the world into which Johnny could not pass .
For those whose chief concern is for Yeats , the book will of course make him seem shadowy and self-deluding , but it will also testify to his conscientiousness and loyalty .
She saw the shadowy movement out of the corner of her eye and she was still reaching for her Beretta when she was struck heavily on the shoulder , knocking the Geiger-Muller counter from her hand .
After a shadowy introduction , the opening allegro is sharp and vehement , the slow movement shot through with unease , and the Scherzo faintly menacing in its nocturnal rustlings .
His motives were shadowy ; he had killed the men who exploited ` his girls " .
Marek had been led to Graham Mills partly by his former lover , Taczek , but the conclusive evidence was provided only by the shadowy Hugh Capron .
Little wonder Suzie had fallen in love with this modern city which proudly displayed so much of its past -- or was it the shadowy Svend who had really captured her sister 's heart ?
Of course , neither should we forget the shadowy Priory of Sion , the organisation that Lincoln spent much time on in his excellent bestseller The Holy Blood and the Holy Grail .
MI6 , Scotland Yard and the FBI had been called in to hunt for the shadowy Surrey-born spy .
THE shadowy men of the SAS made no secret of the fact it was Christmas party time -- neighbours could hear the noise a mile away .

There are indications , however , that certain personnel who were intimately involved in the program , including Basson , may have provided technical knowledge , equipment , or materials to `` rogue regimes '' such as Libya , to foreign intelligence personnel , to unscrupulous black marketers trafficking in dangerous weapons , and perhaps also -- if certain journalists can be believed -- to elements of a shadowy international network of right - wing extremists .

There are indications , however , that certain personnel who were intimately involved in the program , including Basson , may have provided technical knowledge , equipment , or materials to `` rogue regimes '' such as Libya , to foreign intelligence personnel , to unscrupulous black marketers trafficking in dangerous weapons , and perhaps also -- if certain journalists can be believed -- to elements of a shadowy international network of right - wing extremists .
